text: Trope is a term for a figure of speech."Figures of Speech: Tropes" at Rhetoric.byu.edu; retrieved 2012-1-14. The term has evolved to identify an overused theme or device. "Trope" at Merriam-Webster Online Dictionary; retrieved 2012-1-24. A trope may mean a convention, a plot trick, a setup, a narrative structure and a character type all at the same time.Tomlinson, Barbara. (2010). Feminism and Affect at the Scene of Argument: Beyond the Trope of the Angry Feminist, p. 1. == List of types== In rhetoric, there are many types of tropes. :This list is not finished; you can help Wikipedia by adding to it. * Allegory * Antithesis * Hyperbole * Irony * Metaphor * Metonymy * Oxymoron * Synecdoche ==References== ==Other websites== * "Tropes" at Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy Category:Figures of speech Category:Narratology Category:Psychology Category:Rhetoric
title: Trope
